title: The following discussion of the Fifty­two Ailments is based on Harper's (1982) translation and exegesis

Wang Qingren's ) helped undermine the conceptual foundations of the medicine of systematic correspondences. His study of internal anatomy began after an epidemic in Luanzhou in 1797, where a cemetery containing the bodies of poor children, buried in shallow graves and dug up and partially devoured by stray dogs, provided what became an opportunity to study internal anatomy. This study led him to question classical medical literature in light of his own observations and challenge traditional ideas about the visceral
There is considerable question about the influence of European ideas on his interest in anatomical aspects of the visceral systems
